scenario_text.value: Oh man... There’s even webs here?
Ewww, enough with the sticky-stick!

This could get bad... We won’t be able to
defend ourselves if we’re attacked here.
Hey, I see light over there, Takuma!
Oh, you’re right! I see it too.
Let’s go, Agumon, on the double!
Yeah!

Whew, we finally made it. You doing okay,
Agumon?
Awww, I’m all ooey-gooey...

Uh...
Well, at least you’re not hurt anywhere.
So then, where are we?
A piano, sheet music... Is this the music room?

(Hmm? I see a dark shadow over there...
No, there are two.)
Someone’s here, Takuma!
Whoa! Is it...the ghost?
Guess you found us.
Are you...human?

(Well he’s talking, and I can’t see through
him...guess that rules out the ghost theory.)

(Still, they don’t exactly feel like normal
people to me, either. What gives?)

(Skin deathly pale against the moonlight,
faces without expression. They look unreal.)
(What’s their deal...?)
You two...
You should leave this school quickly.
Huh?
You must not provoke them.

(The boy’s words have a certain bite to
them...)

(He doesn’t seem to bear any ill will, but
he seems to think we’re a nuisance...)
(And who are this “them” he’s talking about?)
Are you talking about the monster?

Yeah. If you get hunted down, you guys
won’t be able to even resist.

(There’s something in his words, even if he
is a kid. Is the enemy that strong...?)
(Well, I know one thing for sure...)

We can’t just leave. Our friends have been
taken. I have to save them, no matter what.

If you know anything, would you please tell
us?
Hmm? What is it?
(That girl is...gesturing to the boy?)
*sigh*... Fine.
I’ll tell you about them.
Really?!
My sister told me to, so...

(Sister... So these two are siblings? She
seems more cooperative than her brother.)

The one after you is a giant spider. It moved
in recently out of the blue and poses as boss.

Ohhh, that must be Dokugumon.
That guy is nasty!

Their den is in the gym, but it is gummed up
with webs.
Yeah, we couldn’t get in there.

They use the crawl space above the ceilings
and under the floors to get around the school.

(We were right, the sound we heard up in the
crawl space was that thing.)

There’s an entrance to the routes they use
under the cafeteria floor. Go look for it.

Oh! The cafeteria, huh? Thanks so much for
telling us!

That thing doesn’t kill its prey right after
abducting them.

But it sucks the life from its prey for
sustenance, so over time they weaken and die.

(Die... Hearing someone else say it really
makes it hit home.)

If you want to save them, I wouldn’t waste
time.
Okay, got it!

Be careful. It won’t give up its prey without
a fight.
(Is he...worried about us?)

(I should be fine, I have Agumon with me.
Still...)
(What should I say to them?)
Will you two be okay?
Are you gonna fight?
We’ll be just fine!
Are you two going to be okay on your own?

We’ll be fine. We’ve been in this school long
before they came, so we know where to hide.
Is that right? Then you two stay here.

(Wait...“long before”? That doesn’t sound
very recent at all...)
(Ah, but I need to focus on the rescue!)

We may not be able to fight, but we’ll have
no trouble hiding. We’ll be fine.
Are you sure?

(I can’t see a boy and a girl surviving on
their own. Are they...on the enemy’s side?)
Who are you two? Why are you here?
We just want to live in peace, that’s all...
(I guess they don’t feel like answering...)

(At the very least, I don’t think they’re
enemies after they gave us all that info.)
Okay, I get it. Then you two stay here.

Don’t worry about us, we have strong friends
like Agumon here!
Yeah, you can count on me!
Huh... You don’t say?

(Neither of them are surprised to see Agumon.
Something definitely doesn’t add up...)
We’re gonna go. Thanks again for your help!
Let’s hurry to the cafeteria, Agumon!
Got it!
